pageContext.description: Dimensions: L 165mm; Wbl. 48; Bst 34.5mm; Wt. 485.8 gms
pageContext.other: Text describing circumstance of find appears to be unfinished.
pageContext.publications: a) BM Donatious Catalogue for 1756-1840, Dec. 14, 1811,b)Promoeval Antiquities - MS vol. (Soc. of Antiquaries), p.168.,c) Davey 1973, 94, pl. XII
pageContext.site: unprovenanced,alt site: burringham moor; burringham; humberside
pageContext.remarks: Circumstances: this was an unprovenanced and unmarked piece in the collections where it was marked in a haft (modern) registered as 1938.3-5.5; it could conceivably be that acquired from Sir Joseph Bawks in 1811, Dec, 14 (a) described as "found in the Isle of Axholm", but this relies on the supposition that the latter was one of the "Isle of Axholm hoard illustrated in Bank's folios (b) and that Banks had obtained at least the palstave therefrom from Mr. G. Stovin (c) the,Context: possibly 1a. Hoard,Label/Markings: formerly marked 1938.3-5.5 by mistake from the haft it was mounted in.
